intro: Phyllanthus udicola, commonly known as the African date palm, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces non-edible, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverine forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
